case_vignette: A 34-year-old male presents with history of itching all over the body ongoing for the past year. He does not take any medications other than multivitamins. He denies any history of skin conditions. He has tried fexofenadine in the past which helped, but over the counter hydrocortisone only provides minimal relief. Pruritus is worse around areas of tight clothing contacting his skin that occurs within a few minutes. Skin examination reveals linear urticaria on the upper back that develop after two minutes in areas of gentle scratching with a cotton tip applicator.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Dermatographic urticaria (also known as dermographism or skin writing).

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing itching all over my body for the past year.
Have you noticed any specific rashes or changes in your skin associated with the itching?
Yes, there are linear raised areas on my upper back that appear after gentle scratching.
Do you have any known allergies or conditions that might explain these symptoms?
No, I don't have any history of skin conditions or known allergies.
Does anyone in your family have similar skin issues or a history of skin conditions?
I don't know of any family members with similar skin issues or a history of skin conditions.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as swelling or redness in the areas where you experience itching?
The itching gets worse around areas where my clothing is tight, but there's no mention of swelling or significant redness.
Have you started using any new skincare products, laundry detergents, or come into contact with any new substances before the itching began?
No, I haven't started using any new skincare products, laundry detergents, or come into contact with any new substances before the itching began.
Do the itching and skin changes improve or worsen with changing seasons or environmental conditions?
The itching and skin changes are consistent and do not improve or worsen with changing seasons or environmental conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatographia (skin writing)
